intro: Trichilia arenaria, commonly known as the sand trichilia, is a small evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Trichilia arenaria is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
